Yes, there are many examples of how political correctness has affected the representation of gender in popular media. Here are a few:

1. Gender-Neutral Language: There has been a shift towards using gender-neutral language in popular media. For example, instead of referring to someone as “he” or “she”, they may be referred to as “they” or “their”. This is an effort to be more inclusive of individuals who do not identify with traditional gender roles.

2. Body Diversity: There has been an increased focus on body diversity in popular media, with a push to feature individuals of all sizes and shapes in magazines, advertisements, and other forms of media. This is to combat the unrealistic beauty standards that have been portrayed in the media for many years.

3. Gender Stereotypes: There has been a push to break down traditional gender stereotypes in popular media. This includes portraying men as sensitive and caring, and women as strong and independent. This is to encourage viewers to see individuals beyond their gender, and to acknowledge that everyone has unique qualities and strengths.

4. Representation of LGBTQ+ Community: There has been a significant increase in the representation of the LGBTQ+ community in popular media. This includes featuring LGBTQ+ characters in TV shows and movies, and promoting LGBTQ+ musicians and artists. This is to normalize LGBTQ+ identities and reduce stigma and discrimination.

Overall, political correctness has had a positive impact on the representation of gender and diversity in popular media. It has encouraged individuals and organizations to be more aware of the impact their words and actions can have on marginalized communities, and has motivated them to strive for more inclusive and representative content.
